Boooo-teeee-fuuuhhhllll.... UNFORTUNATELY I don't run 300 buttons worth of mods, so I'm not going to get a lot of use out of this, but, still, looks great. How are you going to treat folders?

How are you going to treat folders?

Not in any special way. They are there if you create them, and they will only contain those buttons you have enabled visibility for.
Looks awesome as usual blizzy. Will this allow full customization of what buttons show where or will they still only be available in the scenes the plugin defines?

They will still only show in the scenes that the plugin author has defined. So in other words, the new feature will let you hide buttons that were previously visible, but it will not let you show buttons that were previously hidden.

So this is not a cheat mechanism to show all MechJeb buttons in early tech tree
Toolbar Plugin 1.5.0 is now available for download, adding the ability to configure visibility of each button.

I like this plugin, but the new update is exceptionally annoying. Why are all buttons disabled by default on every in-game screen? Why is there a pop-up message on every in-game screen? Wouldn't it have made much more sense to leave the interface as-is, but to add the ability remove buttons if desired?

Also, the rapid pace of updates combined with the in-game notifications has gotten annoying-- especially since you need to quit the game in order to update the mod. Even with my solid state drive, it takes about a minute to load KSP, so I usually don't want to update right away for tiny incremental things. Could you add a "snooze notification" feature to let us turn off the in-game prompt until the next update comes out for those of us who check the release notes and don't see a reason to update right away?

Every time I start the game I get the message a new version of toolbox blah blah blah and the configure your visible buttons dialog pops up but I have already configure the buttons for my starting screen.

Is it supposed to bring up the configure button thing every single time I start the game?

No, it should only do that if it recognizes a new button that got available, for example from a new plugin you've installed. If there are no new buttons that could be interesting to you, and if you configured the buttons that should be visible, it should not pop up again.

The button "Toolbar Plugin Update Available" is always visible as long as the version you've installed is not the latest one. Are you perhaps confusing the two?
